channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-20589] Don't need to assign meta to a new RS when standby master become active
item.description: I found this problem when I write ut for HBASE-20569. Now the master  finishActiveMasterInitialization introduce a new RecoverMetaProcedure(HBASE-18261) and it has a sub procedure AssignProcedure. AssignProcedure will skip assign a region when regions state is OPEN and server is online. But for the new regiog state node is created with state OFFLINE. So it will assign the meta to a new RS. And kill the old RS when old RS report to master. This will make the master initialization cost a long time. I will attatch a ut to show this. FYI stack
item.summary: Don't need to assign meta to a new RS when standby master become active

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Tell me more about 'reglog' state Guanghao or just point me at where I should read sir. Thanks.
Yeah, maybe bit of logging that shows whats happening in the background for your nice unit test. Thanks.

2018-05-16 08:31:44,077 INFO  [Thread-409] master.ServerManager(887): Finished waiting on RegionServer count=3; waited=1261ms, expected min=3 server(s), max=3 server(s), master is running
2018-05-16 08:31:44,384 DEBUG [Thread-409] procedure2.ProcedureExecutor(884): Stored pid=29, state=RUNNABLE:RECOVER_META_PREPARE; RecoverMetaProcedure failedMetaServer=null, splitWal=true
2018-05-16 08:31:44,476 INFO  [PEWorker-3] procedure.RecoverMetaProcedure(125): Start pid=29, state=RUNNABLE:RECOVER_META_SPLIT_LOGS; RecoverMetaProcedure failedMetaServer=null, splitWal=true
2018-05-16 08:31:44,569 INFO [PEWorker-3] procedure.RecoverMetaProcedure(157): pid=29, state=RUNNABLE:RECOVER_META_ASSIGN_REGIONS; RecoverMetaProcedure failedMetaServer=null, splitWal=true; Retaini ng meta assignment to server=hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886 2018-05-16 08:31:44,569 INFO [PEWorker-3] procedure2.ProcedureExecutor(1515): Initialized subprocedures=[

{pid=30, ppid=29, state=RUNNABLE:REGION_TRANSITION_QUEUE; AssignProcedure table=hbase:meta, region=1588230740, target=hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886}

]
2018-05-16 08:31:44,713 INFO [PEWorker-15] procedure.MasterProcedureScheduler(640): pid=30, ppid=29, state=RUNNABLE:REGION_TRANSITION_QUEUE; AssignProcedure table=hbase:meta, region=1588230740, target=hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886 checking lock on 1588230740
2018-05-16 08:31:44,713 INFO [PEWorker-15] assignment.AssignProcedure(218): Starting pid=30, ppid=29, state=RUNNABLE:REGION_TRANSITION_QUEUE; AssignProcedure table=hbase:meta, region=1588230740, target=hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886; rit=OFFLINE, location=hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886; forceNewPlan=false, retain=true

 

The red log is the problem. The AssignProcedure thought meta is offline and will assign meta to a new region server. I thought the right behavior should return false directly and don't need assign meta...

protected boolean startTransition(final MasterProcedureEnv env, final RegionStateNode regionNode)
    throws IOException {
  // If the region is already open we can't do much...
  if (regionNode.isInState(State.OPEN) && isServerOnline(env, regionNode)) {
    LOG.info("Assigned, not reassigning; " + this + "; " + regionNode.toShortString());
    return false;
  }
  ......
}

2018-05-16 08:31:45,872 INFO  [Thread-409] master.HMaster(3604): hbase:meta deployed at=hao-optiplex-7050,44270,1526430656935

2018-05-16 08:31:45,966 INFO [Thread-409] master.ServerManager(596): Processing expiration of hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886 on hao-optiplex-7050,36490,1526430656813
2018-05-16 08:31:46,030 INFO [RpcServer.default.FPBQ.Fifo.handler=3,queue=0,port=36490] assignment.AssignmentManager(1004): META REPORTED: rit=OPEN, location=hao-optiplex-7050,44270,1526430656935, table=hbase:meta, region=1588230740
2018-05-16 08:31:46,030 WARN [RpcServer.default.FPBQ.Fifo.handler=3,queue=0,port=36490] assignment.AssignmentManager(1006): META REPORTED but no procedure found (complete?); set location=hao-optiplex-7050,44270,1526430656935
2018-05-16 08:31:46,039 DEBUG [RpcServer.default.FPBQ.Fifo.handler=3,queue=0,port=36490] master.ServerManager(390): Server REPORT rejected; currently processing hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886 as dead server
2018-05-16 08:31:46,040 DEBUG [RpcServer.default.FPBQ.Fifo.handler=3,queue=0,port=36490] ipc.CallRunner(142): callId: 56 service: RegionServerStatusService methodName: RegionServerReport size: 389 connection: 127.0.1.1:51136 deadline: 1526430716039, exception=org.apache.hadoop.hbase.YouAreDeadException: Server REPORT rejected; currently processing hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886 as dead server
2018-05-16 08:31:46,044 ERROR [RS:0;hao-OptiPlex-7050:41617] helpers.MarkerIgnoringBase(159): ***** ABORTING region server hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886: org.apache.hadoop.hbase.YouAreDeadException: Server REPORT rejected; currently processing hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886 as dead server

 

After the meta was assigned to the new RS hao-optiplex-7050,44270,1526430656935, the old RS hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886 will be aborted when it report to master. This will make the master initialization cost a long time.
Add a fix in 002 patch. It will save the OPENED meta region state to region stats. So the AssignProcedure will get OPENED region state and skip the region assign.

-1 overall

I ran TestMetaAssignmentWithStopMaster without patch which passed.

What's the expected behavior ?

What's the expected behavior ?

There should be Aborting log or Killing log about RS but the unit test doesn't do it.

You only run the ut once and passed? Try more times?

Add a 004 patch. Add one line change in AssignProcedure. If the meta region already opened, it need finishTransition, too. As it will call AM.markRegionAsOpened in finishTransition. This is nesserary to tell AM that the meta is initialized.

This message was automatically generated.

What is "...new regiog state..."? You say "...node is created with state OFFLINE...". Which node is this? The node in master memory for hbase:meta? Sorry for all the questions. Trying to understand what has changed. Generally we go through the hbase:meta AssignProcedure steps to confirm that the hbase:meta is in the place it claims to be... Even unto asking the current server to open the hbase:meta. It will reject the request saying it already open if carrying the region.... and then we'll know its indeed where it claims to be.

The meta state is marked as OFFLINE on new master start and it used to be what was in zk which would have been the last state set on last hbase:meta assign?

On the patch, I'm not mad about calling finishTransition(env, regionNode) .. from other than the last step in the assign procedure. Whats the reason for not setting next step as finish and calling finishTransition instead? Set next state in starttransition to REGION_TRANSITION_FINISH ? Thanks.

What is "...new regiog state..."? You say "...node is created with state OFFLINE...". Which node is this? The node in master memory for hbase:meta?

The region node for hbase:meta. Because the master is new, it create a new node for hbase:meta and the state is OFFLINE. This will make the AssignProcedure assign hbase:meta to a new RS.
Master should create hbase:meta region node from zk when the meta region already opened?

Master should create hbase:meta region node from zk when the meta region already opened?

This sounds right. If we are not doing this, seems like a mistake. For user-space regions, see how we populate regionstatenode via a scan of hbase:meta table which has last region state in it.

Thanks for digging into this zghaobac. Good find. And thanks for keeping with it.

2018-05-16 08:31:44,713 INFO [PEWorker-15] procedure.MasterProcedureScheduler(640): pid=30, ppid=29, state=RUNNABLE:REGION_TRANSITION_QUEUE; AssignProcedure table=hbase:meta, region=1588230740, target=hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886 checking lock on 1588230740
2018-05-16 08:31:44,713 INFO [PEWorker-15] assignment.AssignProcedure(218): Starting pid=30, ppid=29, state=RUNNABLE:REGION_TRANSITION_QUEUE; AssignProcedure table=hbase:meta, region=1588230740, target=hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886; rit=OFFLINE, location=hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886; forceNewPlan=false, retain=true
2018-05-16 08:31:44,717 INFO [IPC Server handler 3 on 41717] blockmanagement.BlockManager(1169): BLOCK* addToInvalidates: blk_1073741842_1018 127.0.0.1:44841 127.0.0.1:45905 127.0.0.1:44416
2018-05-16 08:31:44,871 INFO [master/hao-OptiPlex-7050:0] balancer.BaseLoadBalancer(1489): Reassigned 1 regions. 0 retained the pre-restart assignment. 1 regions were assigned to random hosts, since the old hosts for these regions are no longer present in the cluster. These hosts were:
hao-OptiPlex-7050
2018-05-16 08:31:44,876 INFO [PEWorker-13] zookeeper.MetaTableLocator(452): Setting hbase:meta (replicaId=0) location in ZooKeeper as hao-optiplex-7050,44270,1526430656935
2018-05-16 08:31:44,980 INFO [PEWorker-13] assignment.RegionTransitionProcedure(251): Dispatch pid=30, ppid=29, state=RUNNABLE:REGION_TRANSITION_DISPATCH; AssignProcedure table=hbase:meta, region=1588230740, target=hao-optiplex-7050,41617,1526430656886; rit=OPENING, location=hao-optiplex-7050,44270,1526430656935

 

New findings: The key problem was the meta region was assigned to a new random region server... Even the assign procedure thought meta is offline and assign it to the old target RS, it is right. But the log shows it assign meta to a new random RS. It is wrong......

New findings: The key problem was the meta region was assigned to a new random region server... Even the assign procedure thought meta is offline and assign it to the old target RS, it is right. But the log shows it assign meta to a new random RS. It is wrong......

Please say more so I can follow-along zghaobac. It says... " 1 regions were assigned to random hosts, since the old hosts for these regions are no longer present in the cluster. "... So it is right that it goes to a new server? (I'm not understanding I think...). Thanks.

" 1 regions were assigned to random hosts, since the old hosts for these regions are no longer present in the cluster. ".

The log shows the old host no longer present in the cluster. But the UT only stop active master and do nothing for RS. So the host should still be present in the cluster.

Ok. I found the problem: BaseLoadBalancer#retainAssignment method thought host hao-optiplex7050 is not same with host haoOptiPlex-7050.

ArrayListMultimap<String, ServerName> serversByHostname = ArrayListMultimap.create();
for (ServerName server : servers) {
  assignments.put(server, new ArrayList<>());
  serversByHostname.put(server.getHostname(), server);
}

for (Map.Entry<RegionInfo, ServerName> entry : regions.entrySet()) {
  RegionInfo region = entry.getKey();
  ServerName oldServerName = entry.getValue();
  List<ServerName> localServers = new ArrayList<>();
  if (oldServerName != null) {
    localServers = serversByHostname.get(oldServerName.getHostname());
  }
  // Because the host name is not same, the localServers is empty, so meta will be assigned to a random server.
  if (localServers.isEmpty()) {
    // No servers on the new cluster match up with this hostname, assign randomly, later.
    randomAssignRegions.add(region);
    if (oldServerName != null) {
      oldHostsNoLongerPresent.add(oldServerName.getHostname());
    }
  }

I add two log in HRegionServer#tryRegionServerReport. The RS's host name is hao-OptiPlex-7050 but the host it reported to master is hao-optiplex-7050.

RegionServerReportRequest.Builder request = RegionServerReportRequest.newBuilder();
+ LOG.info("Server name is " + this.serverName + " host is " + this.serverName.getHostname());
ServerName sn = ServerName.parseVersionedServerName(this.serverName.getVersionedBytes());
+ LOG.info("Try region server report server name is " + sn + " host is " + sn.getHostname());
request.setServer(ProtobufUtil.toServerName(sn));

2018-05-21 14:16:58,084 INFO [RS:1;hao-OptiPlex-7050:46818] regionserver.HRegionServer(1194): Server name is hao-optiplex-7050,46818,1526883412677 host is hao-OptiPlex-7050

This message was automatically generated.
So what is final solution here? Case insensitive or case sensitive?

The 007 patch only fixed the RS reported ServerName. Host name is changed after getVersionedBytes and parseVersionedServerName in old implementation. Now ServerName is case insensitive. But host name is a string, so I thought it must be case sensitive...
At least for DNS it will treat the hostname as case insensitive...
BaseLoadBalancer use host name as a map key. So it is case sensitive in BaseLoadBalancer. All case like this should be fixed if we decide to treat host name as case insensitive.

Let's fix BaseLoadBalancer first. For other places let's do them in another issue. I think for logging it is OK to use the original string, but if we want to use the hostname as a key, we'd better use the lower case.
